newsitem.title: USA: Howell changes top executives, buys company.
newsitem.headline: Howell changes top executives, buys company.

text.p: Howell Corp said Wednesday that it founder, Paul Howell, is retiring as chief executive officer and president of the company, effective immediately, but will remain a member of the board of directors.
Ronald Hall, chairman of the board of directors, resigned the chairmanship, but also will remain a member of the board.
Howell said it named Donald Clayton chairman and chief executive officer and Richard Hebert president and chief operating officer.

The company said that it has entered into a letter of intent to acquire Voyager Energy Corp, a Houston-based exploration and production company founded by Clayton and Hebert, for about 340,000 shares of Howell common stock.
The securities to be issued by Howell in the merger would represent about seven percent of Howell's common stock currently outstanding.
Howell would also assume about $1.3 million in Voyager debt as a result of the merger.
The company said it expects to close this transaction by July 30.
